content: I have about 1 btc in my account. I want to exchange it for eth. 20% off sale it is also possible.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: jossi_1 on July 14, 2022, 10:39:15 AMI have about 1 btc in my account. I want to exchange it for eth. 20% off sale it is also possible.+90 0534 059 3351 whatsapp only.Let me guess, you offer the 20% bonus because you cannot withdraw from the alleged account or similar "surprises"?What would be the good reason for not using any known exchange (of any kind) for that trade? This smells very fishy...

comments.author: alterra57
comments.body: Quote from: jossi_1 on July 14, 2022, 10:39:15 AMI have about 1 btc in my account. I want to exchange it for eth. 20% off sale it is also possible.+90 0534 059 3351 whatsapp only.If you can send 1 BTC to my account send me your Discord or Telegram and I will be able to do it today. If not, stop trying to scam people.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Why would anyone offer a 20% discount?  I mean, what legitimate reason would someone have to give away money?  Rhetorical questions really; this looks like an attempt to lure in the greedy for a scam.

comments.body: be careful every1 as this turdface is a scammer and wants you to send firstsent me a screenshit but the idiot to photoshop it the right way hahahahahabsbshahaahhahaha

comments.author: 16xypjnxlrew
comments.body: Quote from: zestVI on July 15, 2022, 08:47:31 PMbe careful every1 as this turdface is a scammer and wants you to send firstsent me a screenshit but the idiot to photoshop it the right way hahahahahabsbshahaahhahahaWhat screenshot are you talking about? Why would he send you a screenshot? This nice guy wants to exchange his BTC for ETH and pay you 20% because he is afraid of these exchanges. He could lose his entire fortune, which is why he wants to trade it in for just 20% off. Be thankful that people like this still exist. I would love to help him, but unfortunately I don’t have any BTC or ETH at the moment, only UST

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: jossi_1 on July 14, 2022, 10:39:15 AMI have about 1 btc in my account. I want to exchange it for eth. 20% off sale it is also possible.Cryptocurrency transactions are Irreversible and therefore all transactions are considered final.If you are willing to accept ecsrow (a third party receives bitcoins from you and then asks the other party to transfer ETH to you) then you may find interest.Other than that, everyone will view it as a scam because it's (too good to be true) especially since your account doesn't contain any business history.
